staxel.onScreenGuide.BefriendingVillager: Every resident in town can be befriended by talking, giving gifts and doing quests.
The ^c:1486b0;heart icon^c:pop; next to villager names indicates how friendly they are with you.
You can increase your friendship with villagers every day by simply talking to them, or giving them gifts they like.
Some villager quests will only unlock once you’ve reached a certain level of friendship with that villager.
staxel.onScreenGuide.BuyingAndSelling.1: Items on shelves can be bought for the price hovering above them, just interact with the item to buy one.
staxel.onScreenGuide.BuyingAndSelling.2: ^c:1486b0;Sell boxes^c:pop; can be found around ^c:1486b0;merchants^c:pop;. Simply put an item in one to get a sell price, then interact with the box to sell it for that price.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Catalogue.1: ^c:1486b0;Honey.Comb^c:pop; is a great way to buy and sell lots of items. All you need is a ^c:1486b0;Catalogue^c:pop; and ^c:1486b0;Shipping Station^c:pop;.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Catalogue.2: Simply interact with the catalogue to open the ordering UI.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Catalogue.3: Things you buy will go into the Shipping station as a big crate the next day.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Catalogue.4: To sell items, simply slot them into the empty spaces in the shipping station. Your petals will be delivered in the big crate the next day.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CatchingBugs.1: ^c:1486b0;Bugs^c:pop; are all over the world, and there’s more to catch every day.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CatchingBugs.2: To catch a bug, simply swing your ^c:1486b0;net^c:pop; while aiming at one.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.1: Cooking works much the same as regular crafting.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.2: There is a large variety of cooking stations that all perform different processes.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.3: To begin a ^c:1486b0;recipe^c:pop;, put the required number of items in the slots on the station.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.4: The station will show you the outcome of the items you’ve placed before you craft it. Simply interact to start the process.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.5: When it’s finished, the result will be placed on the station, simply interact to pick it up.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.6: You can view your available ^c:1486b0;recipes^c:pop; on the inventory screen, by clicking the ^c:1486b0;pan^c:pop; icon.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Cooking.7: Use the pin icon or (default) ^c:1486b0;Gamepad A^c:pop; on an entry to pin a step-by-step guide to cooking it on your screen.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CowCare.1: ^c:1486b0;Cows^c:pop; are great friends to keep around your farm.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CowCare.2: Be sure to pet and feed them every day though, keep their ^c:1486b0;trough^c:pop; filled and they’ll eat from it. You can pet or feed them directly by interacting.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CowCare.3: If you get a ^c:1486b0;Milker^c:pop;, your cows will give you milk every day so long as they’re healthy. Simply interact with the Milker in hand to get ^c:1486b0;milk^c:pop;.
staxel.onScreenGuide.CowCare.4: If a cow becomes sick, it won’t produce milk. Make sure to pet and feed it to restore it’s health.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.1: You can craft items with ^c:1486b0;blueprints^c:pop; at crafting stations.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.2: There is a large variety of crafting stations that all perform different processes.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.3: To begin a ^c:1486b0;blueprint^c:pop;, put the required number of items in the slots on the station.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.4: The station will show you the outcome of the items you’ve placed before you craft it. Simply interact to start the process.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.5: When it’s finished, the result will be placed on the station, simply interact to pick it up.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.6: You can view your available ^c:1486b0;blueprints^c:pop; on the inventory screen, by clicking the ^c:1486b0;hammer^c:pop; icon.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Crafting.7: Use the pin icon or (default) ^c:1486b0;Gamepad A^c:pop; on an entry to pin a step-by-step guide to crafting it on your screen.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Fishing.1: Fishing is a great way to earn some extra petals.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Fishing.2: Simply aim at a water tile and use a ^c:1486b0;Fishing Rod^c:pop; on it.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Fishing.3: When you get a fish on the hook, reel it in while making sure not to over-tense the line.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GettingStarted.1: Hit (default) ^c:1486b0;M key^c:pop; or ^c:1486b0;DPad Right^c:pop; to enter and exit map mode.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GettingStarted.2: You can sprint by double tapping (default) ^c:1486b0;W Key^c:pop; or ^c:1486b0;Left Thumbstick Up^c:pop;.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GettingStarted.3: When villagers talk to you during ^c:1486b0;Quests^c:pop;, it's logged in your journal. Press (default) ^c:1486b0;J Key^c:pop; or ^c:1486b0;Gamepad X^c:pop;.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GrowingCrops.1: Use a ^c:1486b0;Hoe^c:pop; on dirt or grass to till the soil.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GrowingCrops.2: Use a ^c:1486b0;Seed^c:pop; on tilled soil to plant it.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GrowingCrops.3: Make sure to water it every day.
staxel.onScreenGuide.GrowingCrops.4: When a plant is ready to harvest, it will have a green outline when looked at. Simply interact with it, or use a ^c:1486b0;Scythe^c:pop; on it, to harvest.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.1: When upgrading or changing existing structures, you might find that you can't place or break anything in them.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.2: This is because their ^c:1486b0;Marker^c:pop; has ^c:1486b0;Area Protection^c:pop; turned on.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.3: All existing structures in town are protected by default.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.4: To edit structures like these, you'll need to interact with their ^c:1486b0;Marker^c:pop; and check the ^c:1486b0;Disable Area Protection^c:pop; option.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.5: Any markers you place yourself will have their area protection disabled by default.
staxel.onScreenGuide.MarkerProtection.6: If you're unsure where a structure's ^c:1486b0;Marker^c:pop; is, try to break or place something inside it, then follow the yellow particle line that appears.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.1: ^c:1486b0;Markers^c:pop; are special tiles that define a region for certain buildings.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.2: They can come in all shapes and sizes, such as signposts, mailboxes and archways.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.3: Markers will have certain requirements that need to be met in order to be considered “complete”. You can check them by interacting with it.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.4: All Markers have a maximum build size. You only need to fit the requirements inside those boundaries though, not the whole building.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.5: You can check the option in the requirements screen to view the Marker boundary.
staxel.onScreenGuide.Markers.6: Certain ^c:1486b0;Markers^c:pop; around the town periodically have their region overwritten for ^c:1486b0;Festivals^c:pop;. You shouldn't move these unless you are absolutely certain you know what you're doing.
